description:
BioPAX Parser is graphical agent to perform pathway enrichment analysis using
BioPAX files. In addition BiP enable user to extract and save pathway information
in a tabular format.
name: BioPAX-Parser

metadata.abstract: Â© The Author(s) 2020. Published by Oxford University Press. All rights reserved. For permissions, please e-mail: journals.permissions@oup.comBiological pathways are fundamental for learning about healthy and disease states. Many existing formats support automatic software analysis of biological pathways, e.g. BioPAX (Biological Pathway Exchange). Although some algorithms are available as web application or stand-alone agents, no general graphical application for the parsing of BioPAX pathway data exists. Also, very few agents can perform pathway enrichment analysis (PEA) using pathway encoded in the BioPAX format. To fill this gap, we introduce BiP (BioPAX-Parser), an automatic and graphical software agent aimed at performing the parsing and accessing of BioPAX pathway data, along with PEA by using information coming from pathways encoded in BioPAX. Availability and implementation: BiP is freely available for academic and non-profit organizations at https://gitlab.com/giuseppeagapito/bip under the LGPL 2.1, the GNU Lesser General Public License.
metadata.title: BioPAX-Parser: Parsing and enrichment analysis of BioPAX pathways
